sections.title: Getting Started
sections.content:
# Getting Started

Welcome to Vyro Studios documentation. This guide will help you get up and running with our premium FiveM content.

## What You'll Need

- FiveM server installation
- Basic Lua knowledge
- A text editor (VS Code recommended)
- MySQL database (for most scripts)

## Installation Overview

- Download your purchased items from our store
- Extract the files to your resources folder
- Configure the necessary database tables
- Restart your server
- Verify the script is running

sections.title: Shops
sections.content:
# Shops System

The shops system is a comprehensive framework for managing shops in your FiveM server.

## Overview

This system allows you to create and manage multiple shops with different configurations. Each shop can have custom items, locations, and features.

## Features

- Multiple shop support
- Custom item pricing
- Shop locations with GPS markers
- Inventory management
- Blip configuration
- Framework support (ESX, QBCore)

sections.title: Shop Installation
sections.content:
# Shop Installation

## Step 1: Extract Files

Extract the downloaded shop resource to your server's resources folder:

```
resources/
  ├── your-shop-resource/
  │   ├── client.lua
  │   ├── server.lua
  │   ├── config.lua
  │   ├── fxmanifest.lua
  │   └── ...
```

## Step 2: Configure Database

Import the SQL file into your database:

```sql
CREATE TABLE shops (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY AUTO_INCREMENT,
    name VARCHAR(255),
    currency VARCHAR(50),
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
);
```

## Step 3: Update Server Configuration

Add the resource to your server.cfg:

```
ensure your-shop-resource
```

## Step 4: Configure Shop Settings

Edit the config.lua file with your shop settings:

```lua
Config.Framework = 'ESX'
Config.MaxShops = 10
Config.ShopBlipSprite = 52
Config.ShopBlipColor = 2
```

## Step 5: Start Server

Restart your server and verify no errors appear in console.

sections.title: Shop Configuration
sections.content:
# Shop Configuration

## Config.lua Structure

Customize the config.lua file for shops:

```lua
Config = {}

-- Framework
Config.Framework = 'ESX' -- Options: ESX, QBCore

-- Shop Settings
Config.MaxShops = 10
Config.DefaultCurrency = 'legal'

-- Blip Settings
Config.ShopBlipSprite = 52
Config.ShopBlipColor = 2
Config.ShopBlipScale = 0.7

-- Shops Table
Config.Shops = {
    shop_1 = {
        name = 'Downtown Shop',
        currency = 'legal',
        items = {},
        targets = {}
    }
}
```

## Shop Item Format

```lua
items = {
    {
        name = 'item_name',
        price = 100,
        amount = 50,
        weight = 1.0
    }
}
```

sections.title: Inventory
sections.content:
# Inventory System

The inventory system manages player items and storage.

## Overview

This system provides a complete inventory management solution with support for multiple storage types, weight limits, and item stacking.

## Key Features

- Item stacking and weight management
- Multiple storage types (player, stash, glovebox)
- Inventory UI with search
- Item transfer between containers
- Drop and pickup items

sections.title: Inventory Installation
sections.content:
# Inventory Installation

## Prerequisites

- FiveM server
- MySQL database
- Framework (ESX or QBCore)

## Installation Steps

### 1. Extract Files

Extract to resources folder:

```
resources/
  └── inventory-system/
      ├── client/
      │   └── main.lua
      ├── server/
      │   └── main.lua
      ├── config.lua
      └── fxmanifest.lua
```

### 2. Create Database Tables

```sql
CREATE TABLE inventory_items (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY AUTO_INCREMENT,
    owner_id INT,
    item_name VARCHAR(255),
    amount INT,
    data JSON,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE inventory_containers (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY AUTO_INCREMENT,
    type VARCHAR(50),
    owner_id INT,
    max_weight DECIMAL(10,2),
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
);
```

### 3. Add to server.cfg

```
ensure inventory-system
```

### 4. Verify Installation

Restart server and check console for:

```
[Inventory] System loaded successfully
```

sections.title: Inventory Usage
sections.content:
# Using the Inventory

## Opening Inventory

Open player inventory with:

```lua
TriggerEvent('inventory:open')
```

## Adding Items

Add items to player inventory:

```lua
exports['inventory-system']:AddItem('player_id', 'item_name', 1)
```

## Removing Items

Remove items from inventory:

```lua
exports['inventory-system']:RemoveItem('player_id', 'item_name', 1)
```

## Checking Items

Check if player has item:

```lua
local hasItem = exports['inventory-system']:GetItemCount('player_id', 'item_name')
if hasItem > 0 then
    print('Player has ' .. hasItem .. ' of this item')
end
```

sections.title: Configuration
sections.content:
# Configuration

## Config.lua Structure

Customize the config.lua file:

```lua
Config = {}

-- Framework
Config.Framework = 'ESX' -- Options: ESX, QBCore, Standalone

-- Database
Config.Database = {
    host = 'localhost',
    username = 'root',
    password = 'password',
    database = 'yourdb'
}

-- Features
Config.EnableFeature1 = true
Config.EnableFeature2 = false

-- Prices
Config.Prices = {
    item1 = 100,
    item2 = 250
}

-- Locations
Config.Locations = {
    {x = 100.0, y = 200.0, z = 30.0, heading = 0.0},
    {x = 150.0, y = 250.0, z = 30.0, heading = 90.0}
}
```

## Framework Configuration

### ESX

```lua
Config.Framework = 'ESX'
local ESX = exports['es_extended']:getSharedObject()
```

### QBCore

```lua
Config.Framework = 'QBCore'
local QBCore = exports['qb-core']:GetCoreObject()
```

sections.title: Events & Exports
sections.content:
# Events & Exports

## Available Events

### Client Events

- `your-resource:clientEvent` - Description here
- `your-resource:playerLoaded` - Triggered when player loads
- `your-resource:playerLogout` - Triggered on logout

### Server Events

- `your-resource:serverEvent` - Description here
- `your-resource:updateData` - Update player data
- `your-resource:deleteData` - Delete player data

## Available Exports

### Server Exports

```lua
-- Get player data
exports['your-resource']:GetPlayerData(playerId)

-- Update player data
exports['your-resource']:UpdatePlayerData(playerId, data)

-- Get item count
exports['your-resource']:GetItemCount(playerId, itemName)
```

### Client Exports

```lua
-- Open UI
exports['your-resource']:OpenUI()

-- Close UI
exports['your-resource']:CloseUI()

-- Get UI status
exports['your-resource']:IsUIOpen()
```

sections.title: Lua Code Examples
sections.content:
# Lua Code Examples

## Tables and Loops

```lua
local players = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5}

for i = 1, #players do
    print('Player ID:', players[i])
end

for k, v in ipairs(players) do
    print(k, v)
end
```

## Conditionals

```lua
local function CheckPlayer(playerId)
    if playerId == nil then
        print('Player ID is nil')
        return false
    elseif playerId > 32 then
        print('Invalid player ID')
        return false
    else
        print('Valid player:', playerId)
        return true
    end
end
```

## String Operations

```lua
local str = 'Hello World'
local upper = string.upper(str) -- HELLO WORLD
local lower = string.lower(str) -- hello world
local sub = string.sub(str, 1, 5) -- Hello
local len = string.len(str) -- 11

-- String formatting
local formatted = string.format('Player %d has %d items', 1, 5)
print(formatted) -- Player 1 has 5 items
```

## JSON Operations

```lua
local data = {
    name = 'Player',
    items = {1, 2, 3},
    settings = {theme = 'dark'}
}

-- Encode to JSON
local jsonStr = json.encode(data)
print(jsonStr)

-- Decode from JSON
local decoded = json.decode(jsonStr)
print(decoded.name) -- Player
```

sections.title: Troubleshooting
sections.content:
# Troubleshooting

## Common Issues

### Resource Won't Start

- Check for syntax errors in fxmanifest.lua
- Verify all dependencies are installed
- Check server logs for error messages
- Ensure the resource name matches in server.cfg

### Database Connection Error

```lua
-- Error: Cannot connect to database
-- Solution: Check database credentials in config.lua
-- Verify MySQL is running
-- Check firewall settings
```

### Export Not Found

```lua
-- Error: Export not found
-- Solution: Ensure resource is started with 'ensure'
-- Check export function name is correct
-- Verify resource is in resources folder
```

## Debug Mode

Enable debug logging:

```lua
Config.Debug = true

if Config.Debug then
    print('^2[DEBUG]^7 Message here')
end
```

## Getting Help

- Check the documentation
- Review the config.lua file
- Check server console for errors
- Contact support at support@vyrostudios.com

sections.title: API Reference
sections.content:
# API Reference

## Server Functions

### GetPlayer(id)

Get a player object by ID

```lua
local player = GetPlayer(1)
if player then
    print('Player found:', player.name)
end
```

### UpdatePlayer(id, data)

Update player data

```lua
UpdatePlayer(1, {
    money = 5000,
    items = {'item1', 'item2'}
})
```

## Client Functions

### OpenUI(data)

Open the UI with optional data

```lua
OpenUI({
    title = 'My UI',
    content = 'Hello World'
})
```

### CloseUI()

Close the current UI

```lua
CloseUI()
```

## Callbacks

### TriggerServerCallback(name, cb)

Call a server function from client

```lua
TriggerServerCallback('GetPlayerMoney', function(money)
    print('You have $' .. money)
end)
```

## Events

### TriggerEvent(name, ...)

Trigger a client event

```lua
TriggerEvent('your-resource:eventName', arg1, arg2)
```

### TriggerServerEvent(name, ...)

Trigger a server event from client

```lua
TriggerServerEvent('your-resource:serverEvent', data)
```
